text:
“I may be bringing you something else in a day or two, Alyona Ivanovna,” he said, fidgeting.

“Valuable?” she asked, intrigued.

“Silver—a cigarette box,” he stammered, then fell silent.

“Are you always alone? Your sister…” he trailed off.

“What business is she of yours?” she snapped.

“Just asking. Good-day, Alyona Ivanovna.” 

He stepped into the street, confusion swirling inside him. 

“Oh, God, how loathsome!” he shouted. 

“Can I… No, it’s nonsense!” 

His heart raced. 

“What filthy thoughts!” 

He stumbled along the pavement, lost in turmoil, jostling passers-by.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences intense confusion and repulsion after visiting Alyona Ivanovna, reflecting on the disturbing thoughts that have plagued him.
